TextView.android:text: A layout is a subclass of ViewGroup which specifies how a particular view should be arranged inside a viewgroup, or the manner in which you want to arrange your views inside a viewgroup.

Common Android Layouts-
 * Linear Layout
 * Relative Layout
 * Frame Layout
 * Table Layout
 *Grid Layout
 *Coordinator Layout

Linear Layout- This layout has only one goal in life, to lay out children views in a straight single row or column(depending weather orientation is set to horizontal or vertical).

 Relative Layout- In relative layout, the position of the children's can be described relative to each other.

 Frame Layout- This layout blocks out an area on the screen for a particular single view item.

 Table Layout- This layout arranges it's children into rows and columns.

 Grid Layout-It places items in arbitrary rows and columns and supporting the same weight as linear layout.

 Coordinator layout- It is a subclass of frame Layout that inherits it's use of layout:gravity to position the children.
